alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 22 at 5:42PM MDT until April 22 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Los Alamos County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Northern Santa Fe County in north central New Mexico... * Until 745 PM MDT. * At 541 PM MDT, a dust storm was located across the Santa Fe Metro area, as well as Zia Pueblo, Cochiti Lake and Chimayo. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 249 and 302. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 282 and 340. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 11 and 19. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Los Alamos, Espanola, White Rock, Pojoaque, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Santo Domingo Pueblo, Chimayo, Santa Clara Pueblo and San Felipe Pueblo. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Santa Fe
